thread.title: Facebook Developing Way to Fingerprint the Camera You Used to Take a Photo
thread.title_full: Facebook Developing Way to Fingerprint the Camera You Used to Take a Photo

title: Facebook Developing Way to Fingerprint the Camera You Used to Take a Photo
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
21 Sep 2015 01:45 AM EST 
So you think you’ve got Facebook’s privacy and security features figured out? The social network has filed a patent detailing work it’s doing on image fingerprinting that could identify you based not on any physical characteristics, but by the characteristics of your camera. According to the patent application, Facebook’s platform would use factors like lens scratches, faulty pixels, color bleed, and image artifacts to create a fingerprint for a camera. Facebook suggests in the patent that this system could be used to track down fraudulent accounts or multiple accounts owned by a single user (which isn’t allowed).
